description: French adoption, Latin adoptio, allied to adoptare (“to adopt”).

entries.meaning: The state of being adopted; the acceptance of a child of other parents as if he or she were one's own child.
examples: A Chinese baby girl was given away for adoption.
Another Chinese boy was put up for adoption.

entries.meaning: Admission to an institution, for example a hospital, clinic, mental asylum.
examples: the adoption of people into hospitals or monasteries

entries.meaning: The choosing and making that to be one's own which originally was not so; acceptance
examples: the adoption of words from another language

entries.meaning: (computing) Transfer between an old system to another (usually better) system.
examples: Our company is considering the adoption of a four-day week.

entries.meaning: (theology) An act of divine grace by which the redeemed in Christ are admitted to the privileges of the sons of God.
(chess, slang) Ten consecutive wins against an opponent.
examples: Infuriated by his adoption yesterday, the chess master has resolved to study twice as long and twice as hard.
